channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Brown bins not emptied, 19th June
item.description:
Two brown wheelie bins (garden waste) have not been emptied for months and should be emptied every week. They are not overflowing and have attracted flies etc. They need urgently emptying and cleaning. They are in the communal store room of Penny Black Court, SE15 2UE, where the communal rubbish and recycling bins are.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2D;89, Carlton Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 32 Keyes Road, 19th June
item.description:
A large hollybush is extending over more than half the pavement making it very difficult to walk past without being scratched and particularly dangerous for partially sighted pedestrians. This is a couciol or housing association property.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keyes Road, London

item.title: Overhanging low branches, 19th June
item.description:
This tree was planted outside my house (many, many years ago) and I don't think it has ever been checked on. The branches now hang low enough for my 7 year old grandson to walk into. I would happily cut the tree myself but feel sure you would prefer your own tree specialist to do the job. I believe this tree poses a risk of injury to the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 273, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown weeds, 19th June
item.description:
Overgrown weeds all down the Bentley Road side passage (opposite bike store by Leylands). Usually these are taken up by council but this year they are not. It doesn’t look good, especially with a business on this street.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Balls Pond Road, Hackney, London
